36788245.review:
This app is incredible. Basically a real-life concert grounds, located in the metaverse. The effects and visuals are beautiful, and there's a bunch of cool mini-activities to explore and check out along with being able to mix your own songs in your private home "cave".

Going to a show with my best friend two states away was an amazing experience, and it really felt like we were there together. The show itself was awesome, with the effects far exceeding anything possible in the real world. Being able to interact with all the other users and hear them talk and cheer was surreal. Stunning game and excited to see where this takes VR!

36485812.review: Really cool, if you can get it to run.  I was able to after doing system menu to desktop and minimizing the mirrored display and disabling power management from steamvr.  I'm not sure if its that or the recent update that helped.  It still seems a little touchy.  I have no complaints with the game other than getting it to run.   Its a great music experience.  It allows you to DJ your own little concert for friends that would show up, also in VR.  Its an interactive rave with concert instances going on in addition to your own personal room.

36255604.review:
Even in such an early state, every time I've logged in and hung out with strangers has been a great experience! I'm absolutely looking forward to seeing where this continues to go. :)

Also, aside from the major releases/shows, there have been consistent weekly meetups organized by the community via the official discord server (https://discord.gg/4nf7hRU), with volunteers DJing and VJing for anyone that'd like to join.

36008156.review:
Holy acid trip!
Where was this 10-15 years ago when I was throwing raves?!?

This is an amazing "game".  I have only had the Oculus for a couple weeks but among the few dozen titles I have tried, this one stands out.  Even if you are not a fan of EDM, the visuals alone are more than enough reason to download it.  I have spent a couple a majority of time just exploring.  There are numerous things to interact with and collect.  You are able to collect "tokens" by finding them scattered about, interacting with others, and by attending events.  You are then able to exchange them for items for your character or for gifts to give others.

There is a DJ booth with dozens of tracks to choose from.  While playing records you have the option to add effects (more available than on a DJM 1000...if anyone knows what that is), mix with a crossfader, and change individual gains.  You can also change the visual effects of the environment around you while playing.

The concerts are visually insane.  This contains one of the most stunning uses of VR as an art form that I have experienced so far.  Personally, it has run flawless for me also so I am unsure of the negative reviews from others recently due to issues they are having.  If I can run it on my old PC without issue than it can be assumed the issue lies with them or their system and not with the game itself.

Oh did I mention it is free?!?
I hope more continue to join in the future so that content continues to be updated

36006559.review: This is fantastic! Super fun so far.

35877311.review:
This is gonna change the way people party!
  Booking some top notch artists as well.

35783089.review: I'm having the same issue as other users. It won't load. Im stuck at the title screen.

35612842.review: This is such an amazing experience! I can't recommend this enough to anyone who has a VR system. It's the perfect blend of music, visual experience, and social interaction. Give this a try if you haven't!

35609186.review: Easily one of the best VR experiences available. The game is very well optimized and appears rather graphically intense while running ever smoothly, a real trip and a half! It feels like such a natural expeirence, talking and engaging with people from anywhere in the world, gathered in a virtual space to party, showing off your legless dance moves for a shameless great time! The TOKiMONSTA wave really felt like a real music festival, with people from everywhere, chillin everywhere, with such a feeling of social freedom in a sense that everyone is really all the same, just partyin avatars without a real face to a name, breaking any possible ice between anybody, offering one of the most humble human expeirences I've witnessed. How easy is it to be yourself, if all you represent is yourself?

35589334.review:
It's a "social VR" world like Alstspace or VRChat, but it's all for EDM and other electronic music!
You can go to a virtual "rave", or hang out in "the expanse" which is like a Burning Man type situation.
You can DJ, and VJ using decks in your Cave, and can invite other players to participate.

The more people who go to this world, the more fun it will be!  Check it out with your VR headset, particularly on a Wednesday night. or toher times when they have a special DJ event.

35586855.review: An excellent look into how people will interact and socialize in the future.  Dancing with strangers in VR while playing with cool visual effects or various interactive installations was amazing.  Can't recommend enough.

35577451.review: This game is a trip! If you haven't you should make a point to get on during a show! I've been on and had the devs drop in and just say hi and ask your opinion. I'll definitely be back :)

35084786.review:
I've lived most of my life in a city that has a music scene that doesn't like electronic music. This deprived me of the experience of club going, all night dance-a-thons (I still begrudgingly engaged my hometown's nightlife, but it never felt the way I wanted it to), complete with neon-adorned toys and chemically induced sense experiences. Since I'm also not independently wealthy, I've never had the ability to attend any of the music festivals known for those sorts of things and more, no Burning Man or Electric Forest or Electric Love Festival. 
The Wave VR has, among other things, given me that experience, from the comfort of my living room. It goes, in fact, beyond whats possible in real life, and gives me everything that I dreamed that experience would be like with none of the petty restrictions of actuality and meat space. 
The first concert series is nearing its close, and I've got fond, genuinely cherished memories of every wave I was able to attend (I missed the first two, but have seen all since). I'm looking forward to more shows, meeting more people, and whatever new territory these devs have in store.

33884638.review:
TL;DR  :  Even if you're not an EDM fan, this is worth at least wandering around in. Hands down one of the best VR experiences available, free or otherwise. Beautiful, fun, and the live shows are absolutely stunning. 


________

I'm not one to usually take the time to review games, but TheWaveVR deserves a few moments of my time, just as it does whole heaps of yours. 

On it's own, it's a well accorded and usually decently populated digital space. You have a private area, your Cave, that gives you a dashboard for friend controls and wardrobe, as well as a dance floor and dj booth. While you're not going to find bleeding edge mixing tools, you're given a few dozen tracks of a decent variety and a handful of intuitive sliders and controls. While the experienced DJ might find it elementary, for the average noob it's a blast to mess around with. And once you feel like you want to show off your skills, you can even invite aforementioned friends over for a concert. 

The public digital space is called the Expanse, and is rather expansive. There is a main hub with a selfie stick and accompanying jumbotron, as well as a store for buying a variety of digital toys, BUT DON'T WORRY! This ISN'T some cheap microtransaction ploy! Money is literally lying all over the Expanse, and all you have to do is wander around and pick it up, marveling at the amazingly large and beautiful digtal space they've built. Movement is simple and intuitive point and click teleporting, and interaction is as simple as reaching out and touching. 

Back at the main hub, you can check out recordings of previous performances they've hosted in the space, but to really see what this is all about, drop in for a live show. It is an absolutely singular, stunning, and genre-defining experience. The entire dance space is alive and responsive, while the sky is cacophony of amazing lights and effects. Dozens of people from all overt the globe are dancing, triggering a huge array of effects, passing the live stream cam around, spinning digital poi....and it ran beautifully the whole time. Stable, smooth, and without any glitches or connection isues. 

Even if you're not an EDM fan, this is worth at least wandering around in. Hands down one of the best VR experiences available, free or otherwise. Beautiful, fun, and the live shows are absolutely stunning.

33845780.review: ZOMG this is amazazing. This is not a game. It kinda feels like being at a rave in space. You are an energy being. It's multiplayer. There are so many reasons to get in here. Maybe you like music? Maybe you would like to dance at an anonymous venue where nobody can actually see you. Maybe you just want to try some "trippy VR stuff". Get in here. It's an experience you will remember.

33823926.review: Its definitly closest thing to the metaverse we got right now.

33823838.review: Wow... Was going into this one thinking I would probably remove it for space but its crazy psychedelic... Too trippy to delete... Gonna save that one for one of those nights where I'm a little loopy...

33823402.review:
Download if you want to see a glimpse of what the future of concerts _could_ be like one day.  

Or don't.  It's free, so I don't know why you wouldn't.  

Attend one of the 'flagship' shows.  While the app is pretty amazing outside of these shows, this is where you can see the possibilities TheWaveVR offers.  It doesn't take long to see why they've already secured ~ 4 mil USD in seed funding.  This is where music is going.  Buckle up.

I attended (is that the right word?) the HEAVYGRINDER set that was hosted on 7/26/2017.  While I ordinarily don't listen to much in the way of EDM, I've done more than my fair share of clubbing back in the day, and this DJ was better than most.  I really liked what I heard.  Listening to EDM remixes of Rage Against The Machine and Glen Danzig songs was pretty amazing at any rate - doing so in a VR space didn't take much away from the experience.

It wasn't lost on me just what sort of opportunity TheWaveVR offers - a potential worldwide venue open to anyone with a HMD, giving an artist the ability to interact with listeners directly, if they so choose.  

I felt like the only thing missing from the experience was paying the requistite 16 dollars a drink, elbowing my way through crowds of Chads to get the to bar, making misguided alcohol-fueled decsions on how and who I'll spend the rest of my evening with.

33823263.review: This creators of captured all of the amazing facets of virtual reality and combined them into a wild musical adventure that they call TheWaveVR.  You can be your own DJ or attend a live show with a group, both are incredibly rewarding.  I attended my first show tonight, and all I can think about is "The Metaverse" from Neal Stephenson's, "Snow Crash."  It literally had that cyber punk kind of feel that I got from reading about virtual concerts in his book.  This is just the beginning of a great venue, and I hope more people take advantage of it!

33823155.review: Just saw Heavy Grinder damn show was dope this is one of the best things in VR.

33814765.review:
TheWaveVR is like entering someones wonderful dream or trip. 

After over a year with the Vive and trying countless Early Access games and experiences I have to say that TheWaveVR is my favorite experience. I tried the Subpak M.2. (a subwoofer in a backpack sold on amazon) with this game and it completly immersed me. 

TheWaveVR is extactly what I imagined a VR game should be: A carefully thought-out, well-designed experience in a compeltely amazing world that is like entering someones dream/trip. The creativity and music is jaw-dropping. All together this makes TheWaveVR a magical world I keep coming back too. 
This game combines interactivity, beautiful visuals, and great music. I love the way you find free virtual-money for amazing usable items and "trips". For example, there are sharable experiences called trips you can use. Air Trip is my favorite! 

I highly recommend you try TheWaveVR under the influence of some substance.

33759283.review: Ever wanted to experience the club life in the comfort of your own home? This game does just that! Definitely an experience that needs to be tried. There is a social lobby where you can meet and chat with other people, as well as a "Home Cave" where you can hang out in your own personal space and DJ virtually. You can even invite friends over to your cave and have a house party! Plus with the regular virtual concerts that they throw, it makes this game a must-own.

If you're a DJ, or are serious about electronic music in general, this game isn't what you're looking for.  It's a toy, not a platform.  You cannot: add your own visuals or music.  You cannot use VVVV or touch designer to create your own show.  You cannot add or create your own music. 

This is a dumb toy to give 'normies' the feeling of being a DJ for 5 minutes.  Go download traktor pro and touch designer and do this for real and learn a new skill.  This thing isn't worth anyones time, plus the visuals in it are really cheesy 'ive been vjing for a month' type of visuals.  

All around garbage.

32972531.review: This thing is awesome. I mean literally, "awe inspiring". Just saw my first show. It was called N-FOLD, or maybe that's who made it. I don't know what I was expecting but I think it was something like this, only this exceeded my expectations. Intense psychedelic graphics plus matching music. It was very cool being in there with other people. Even though there were about 20 people in the lobby cave, when you went into the show it is limited to 4 each room for a more intimate experience. I think this was a good decision on there part. I wouldn't want too many people, but I might like to try it with say, up to ten. Mine froze up a couple times and one time I had to reboot PC and got a No Bootloader Found, error but it was bogus and it booted on the next try. One time coming back in, it told me they were having network problems and I had to try about three times to get back in the game. Once in the actual "show" the system seemed more stable. Hey, for free, early access beta, THIS THING IS GREAT! The most "immersive" VR experience I've had yet!

EDIT: 7/3/17

31945197.review:
This is a cool social music app. To get the most out of it note when the next show is and visit then. The music featured so far has been electronic. Most things work pretty well but it can get a bit laggy with a lot of people or graphics stuff going on. The graphical stuff can come from stuff going on in the show, 'trips', 'party poppers', or 'toys'.

The trips alter the way stuff looks and needs two people to activate. The party poppers are something like a disco ball the flys up using a pre-made animation. The toys are things like bubbles or fire spinners that you mess with. The stuff going on during a show is like the trips. It appears a lot of it uses shaders to get cool effects and can use models or pre-made animations for other effects.

The game is free to play. Currently there are no micro transactions but there is an in-game currancy that is earned through in-game actions. The currency can be used to by in-game items. Trips and party poppers are one time use while the toys can be used whenever unlimited. I'd expect they'd want to monitize at some point but they can do this with cosmetics. I mean there is no real gameplay and the game is all about social features and music.

31942716.review: Pretty great. I wonder if we can import our own music to mix?

31531453.review:
Update for September 25:

This game continues to steal my heart and my Wednesday nights. A lot of the bugs from before (like the awful lag and constant network issues) are fixed!! The community is so active and interactive- I love planning and attending community events with other players. While it does suck that the weekly shows have been cut back to biweekly, it's caused the users to stand up and start our own stuff! And those of us who are pretty hard-core into this game know that the Devs are just going to keep dishing out the good stuff to make the shows and game better with every update. <3

Original Review: May
This game is fantastic! Neverbefore did I feel so safe doing and sharing drugs with strangers! 

For a free game, it's a must-have for any VR-gamers. Everyone I've met in-game has been incredibly nice (and generous!).

My only gripe is that when the live concerts go online, the game ends of crashing after minutes of constant refreshing/loading.

Update for July 26th, 2017:

THIS GAME IS STILL AWESOME AND JUST KEEPS GETTING BETTER!! Seriously! New venues, N-Fold on repeat for anyone who can't make the Wednesady night parties... This is definitely the best game in my VR library, regardless of it being free.

31346682.review:
Do remeber that this is at this time an early access game. honestly i love the develpers for doing this because for over 6 months we all saw the page and all saw the advertisments and all wanted this game.

As the game is now i would give it a 6 or 7 out of 10. I will admit i have very high standards and getting anything above a 5 means it was a game worth playing to the end. However as harsh as i sound this game has several things that would make it a 10/10 and i am positive that they will get to it very soon.

so let's look at what is in the game. well i atended 1 event. i spent the whole time there and it was magical. this game is a visual masterpice that lets you dance and have fun with other people while listening to music. to help get the party started the game has what i call digial trips. while doing odd things with the trippy art and such it looks like you are dancing so everyone dances and no one is shy. 

now lets look at what can improve and will likely be implimented
1) we have the money system. i guess this prevents people from spamming stuff should it be free but it kind of sucks that you have to run around the loby grabbing cash. no big deal, i understand.
2) the digial trips. several of them suck. but hey, it is early access so i would expect up to 20-50 of these by the time it is final.
3) public DJ events. well lets face it, it would be nice if you could rent a public room where anyone can join. right now all you can do is make friends with enveryone and have them join your private cave.
4) the boring loby. while it has nice art it is huge and not much to do.
5) more shows. no like seriously, not sure if this is a good thing or not but people just can't get enough of this thing!

all in all for now i will give it a 8/10 for the added potential for this to turn into a world changing game.

31336283.review: very great start. kind of like burning man.

31329167.review: Didn't know what to expect...but it's great

31328858.review: I've played 5 or 6 VR music games searching for a certain feeling... all fall short. Milkdrop in Virtual Desktop is my normal fall back. But this... THIS IS WHAT I'VE WANTED!! I can play around with this for hours. Thank you devs!

31312656.review: This is the most awesome thing ever. 10/10 God bless you for creating this.

31276970.review:
The virtual rave featuring Zack Sheppard blew my mind (4/19/2017). I've been in VR for over a year, and I love that I am continually impressed at such a high level. I will definitely be at the next live show.

I can see where they can make a variety of tweaks to improve the experience, but the core aspect of a virtual music festival/concert/rave and social party is already solid.

31269680.review: Really fun game/experience.  I wish more VR games went in this direction.  There's limitless possibilities with this tech and the devs are going beyond anything that's been done before.  I'm really happy with what they've accomplished and look forward to seeing where they take it.

31259102.review: This is what VR was built for. There's some really genius design in here, from the "social trips" to the weekly shows. Far and away the best social VR game out there in my opinion. It's an early access title and it's not without its hitches--there were network troubles with last week's show, and when there's a lot of people in a room doing stuff the framerate dips a bit because there's just so many particle effects--but honestly it's just so damn cool that I can't even begin to care about that. I'm so glad TheWave exists.

31255485.review: This thing is amazing. It's the most social thing I've seen in VR, everybody has a great time dancing and DJing. The visual effects are insane, they are really taking advantage of what can be done in VR. As many other reviews said it really is psychadelic, and if you have the opportunity to play it with actual psychadelics, I'd highly recommend it..

31251709.review: If you're a party animal like me, then you will love dis. 420 friendly game with lots of electronic dance music

31250860.review:
Download this for a rave in VR like you can't even begin to imagine.  AMAZING visuals and music.  It's FREE, too!!!  
Just did the 2nd concert and I was totally blown away by it all.  Even after the set, the DJ, Zack Sheppard,  hung around and talked with everyone, super cool guy, and they were going to do another mini show, but I had to go.  

This really shows the potential for VR to do things never before possible in PC/games ever before.  Thank you to all the developers and DJs.  Great job!

31249499.review:
The first VR app that I actually want to return to over and over again.

It's such a treat to be able to hang out with an incredible crowd in a social space that can't exist in reality. The visuals, the trips, the incredible connections you can make with strangers over a shared love for music and beautiful visuals...it's truly something special. Nothing beats the feeling of sharing a weird, trippy virtual experience with a complete stranger. And if you're an introvert but want to enjoy to the music, there are plenty of secrets hidden throughout the world that allow you to explore and discover magical moments on your own.

What makes it even better is the contributions from our favorite VR artists (cabbibo, aaf.nyc) -- giving us an opportunity to experience a little bit of their magic with the compan yof other people. 

And I'm like, level 4 now soooooo you can say it's getting pretty serious.

TLDR: this shit is DOPE.

31249481.review: Best when played with friends. Really feels like the future of parties with friends who you cannot otherwise get together with in person. Live DJing is really cool. Reminds me a lot of an episode of Black Mirror, where the characters party at clubs from different time periods. Really, really cool when the crowd starts unleashing potions together. What else? A social furries' wet dream, you could say.

31249353.review: I just got out of the "Weekly Wave" and, I have to say.....it motivated me to not only write this review (which is extremely rare for me), but also to write an article for VR Today Magazine (for which I'm an editor). Apparently every Wednesday they perform a show at 7pm PDT/PST, which is 9pm for me in Austin. I wasn't sure what to expect but HOLY COW, I can now see why they raised $4mm in their Seed Round of funding. I never thought I'd experience an acid trip ever again after leaving college but when they put on the show with the visual effects combined with the music and sharing "experiences" with other people....it definitely felt like I was tripping on acid again. The only other game to keep my attention this long was Werewolves Within by Ubisoft because it's so laid back. This game/experience, however, makes you want to dance the entire night away. By the time I knew it, it was over an hour and a half later and the show was over. I didn't plan on staying in that long but the show combined with friends and sharing these orbs you buy and "experience" with other players is just too fantastic to stop mid-show. I have no idea how they plan to monetize this since it's free, but grab it while you can!!

I did not because I wanted to be surprised and wow - I was!  Congrats to the team that built this very cool space and the DJ - Zach Sheppard.  Awesome job. 31184034.review:
Do you like going to clubs or raves? If not, what if the club came to you? This is a music festival in your own room. Meet a bunch of other festival goers, experience the bizarre installations, and play music in your own personal hangout for friends with reactive visuals. Once you have seen all that, come back for the Live Event, a stage like no other with fantastic live music mixing by professionals. Before you go, make sure you buy some disco balls and some psychedelic "trips" to share with the other festival goers.

The experience is free. Why not try it out and see if the community is your cup of tea?

31173681.review: Super trippy, has awesome people, amazing concept and so much potential. Will definitely try to attend as many live shows as I can.

31172073.review:
Acid trip dance club VR, where random people will offer you drugs, buts it's ok because they only last 30 seconds or so.

A bit hard to figure out how to do things at the beginning, but a good trip the entire way through. It's online with a social hub, and you can make friends with others really easily and then go to their personal 'caves' when they are putting on a show.

Basically you can DJ by mixing two records together, and mess with the sound and also the visuals around the 'club'. A station controls the sound, another the visuals, and both seem to give a lot of control to the users - but also allow newbies to just try things and end up with fun results. Im better skilled musicians could really do some awesome things with this!

31171590.review:
Amazing experience. Brilliant concept. Must try if you are at all interested in electronic music/visual. 

Incredible social experience. In my opinion, this is THE VR app.

Would be incredible with Manus VR (Add light gloves!)

The decks of course need more functionality, and custom music load-in is an absolute MUST. However, we've been promised these are incoming features!

Amazing work guys. Absolutely awesome.

31171341.review: Really fun and trippy, I would have paid money for this game!

31166725.review:
The Wave VR is, in a word, groundbreaking.

Take note. This is the future of Social VR. We're only peering at the tip of the iceberg, but this game plays on a tried-and-true concept from the Devkit days, and combines it with EDM culture to create a double whammy of awesome. Everything feels cool about this, dancing, DJing, it all feels like you're the center of attention in a virtual world. One-on-one time with strangers in short 'trips' makes for a totally mind-bending experience. Conversations will start, friendships will be made, and EDM will be enjoyed if you choose to download this game. Furthermore, the possibilities are endless. The potential of the game has hardly scratched the surface, and if the devs are true to their word there is far more to come.

My advice?

Get in early, and get in fast! Who knows how long they're going to be giving something this incredible away for free...

31166079.review: Really enjoyed this. Hopped in the game late last evening and joined a bunch of random people to make music since there wasn't a concert going on. Excited for Wednesday to see what its like when everyone is here

31165976.review: For some this is the killer VR app we have been waiting for...

31150873.review: Awesome App! Great visuals and sound sphere. Would be great if the developers add an track selection of your own music in the home zone. I hope more events upcoming these days cause european people sleep at their regular play times.

31148577.review:
Fantastic game. If you want to know what raving in VR is like or want to experiment with psychedelics for short periods of time, this is your game!

If you want to be social and just hang out, talk to people, and play with toys, you can do that. If you want to throw a party in your home base, you can do that, too! I did have the pleasure of being able to attend one of the shows and it's really fun. I'm looking forward to the next one and flexing my own DJ skills in the meantime.

31148098.review:
I'm incredibly cynical about VR software right now. 99% of it is absolute garbage, and the remaining 1% is overpriced or overstays its welcome. 

That being said, this is incredible. The most psychedelic thing I have ever experienced outside of literally doing psychedelics. This is the future of live music - at least, the future of live electronic music.

I was expecting a fun but shallow EDM simulator, but instead I got a strange alien Rec Room where people were congregating to go on "trips" together, playing with strange colorful toys, and organizing impromptu shows where one of us would DJ, one of us would get on visuals, and everyone would have the time of their lives. 

I can't wait to see what the actual live shows are like.

31146508.review: Can't say anything that already hasn't been said -- this is amazing!

31145759.review: WOW.this experiance is nothing short of amazing.first i had a mooch around the social area and shared sum trips with other curious revelers.the visuals and audio are the best ive seen and heard and the fractuals are very powerful.then stumbled on to the dj booth,honestly fantastic fun.the algorithm is very good and it was nice to have a selection of tunes.how do you play ur own music?would like to see more features on the mixer.i missed the live show cant wait till the next.well done devs this was well worth the wait and exeeded my expectations even at this stage

31144021.review:
Even in its current state, this seems to be the most promising live music VR experience out there. The interface is easy and accessible, and no noticeable problems connecting to and interacting with other players. The art direction is sleek and tasteful, adding a perfect atmosphere to electronic music. 

My only complaint is when there isn't a show going on, the average player will probably get bored and confused, so I'm hoping they'll come up with more things to do between shows.

One thing I find particularly funny is when a player doesn't realize their mic is on. They'll walk in on a show happening and make an audible "WOAAH!" as some insane sensory overload of an effect is happening around them.

31141673.review: Great experience, but I would love to have more music to d.j with. This is the future for vr and it's looking fantastic!!!!

mad concept for a game/social experaince...i used to party loads when i was a teen, but now, not so much..this takes me right back...even down to the p;oint of buying and sharing trips with people lol...

i wish that someone was able to host a party and friends and non friends alike could join in, when I played nothing was going on so logged out...for this to become a success there will have to be parties every night, or at least over the whole weekend..

31136634.review: I had the great pleasure to see an early show. I found the experience to be amazing. Upon first entering into the software I found getting used to moving around to be intuitive and inviting.  The pre-show area was fun to navigate and explore. Other people in the area were experimenting with many of the colorfuly visual effects that each person can manipulate during a show. When the show started we were immediately emersed in an amazing environment of color, patterns, and sound. The crowd at the show was very friendly and interacted as we made our avatars dance and play with the world around us. The people around me were exclaiming that the show was incredible. In all the folks at TheWave VR have really captured what it means to have a VR experience. This is amazing software and I am excited to see how this software develops as VR becomes more widely adopted. Thank you for putting your time and effort into this endeavor. I believe you are on to something here that will be very special.

31132898.review: Meet up with other people around the world to experience live shows (when available) in a weird world littered with strange anomalies

31132821.review: It's really fun but listing it as having a single player mode implies it can be used solo offline. I wish that when I was offline I could still use the D.J. system and play with the share objects on my own. I'd happily pay for that, cause sometimes I cannot be or do not want to be connected. Please let me purchase and download all the basic abilities. Still really cool though.

31132124.review:
This is the stuff of dreams. Visionary virtual realities as dreamed by the likes of  Neal Stephenson, in his seminal sci-fi novel, Snowcrash. This is the Metaverse,  his fevered dream made flesh by the forward thinking visionaries at The Wave. Interacting with my fellow denizens of the virtual realm was intuitive and natural.  I met many wondeful people in this world. I felt at home, and that is a precious commodity in these times.

  I stumbled across an after hour party hosted by one of the devs, Grimecraft. He was exhausted, as was Adam Arrigo, CEO of The Wave. They had been in VR for countless hours, evangelizing this glorious Alice in Wonderland experience that they and their team had created. We got invited to Grimecraft's personal homespace. His cave. And he DJed the last party of the first day. And it was glorious. And Adam shared his toys with us and I felt a kinship with those in the room. As if I'd taken XTC except I was totally sober. 

 There was a young guy in the room, 14 or 15, and British, by his accent. He questioned Adam, and exclaimed his wonderment at the experience. And I was uplifted hearing him. For I realized there was hope in the world, for a positive future. His wonderment healed my soul, eased my typical cynicism. And that is priceless. 

 April 13, 2017. A day I shall always remember. For today the Metaverse was born. And I was there and transformed, forever.

31131689.review: This was one of the craziest experiences I have had in a VR game I can't wait to see what is yet to come!! The social interaction is fun and this is the trippiest ( I cannot think of a better description) game I have played and in VR on top of that.. the social club is filled with exploration of sights and sounds all while other players are in there exploring as well.. then there's the live shows. I haven't experienced that yet but really looking forward to it!! Then there's your personal "cave" and in your cave you have your own DJ station.. The music that's available for you to choose and play is GREAT it had me dancing while jamming.. there's so much potential here.. and if this is what we get for free already I will be checking in often to see this develop!

31131620.review: I really don't write reviews but I had to make an exception because this app is awesome, this is the future of social vr. Do yourself and download the app it's really that good.

31131101.review: This game is a fucking RIOT!

31130700.review: The ultimate place to just be.

31130534.review: Wow, please play this game. You will absolutely love it. Connecting with people through music and trippy visuals is incredible and I would recommend this experience to anyone and everyone!

31130131.review:
We all must look pretty ridiculous dancing around in the living room with the headset on... Definitely, an experience "tripping" with other people and even getting the chance to speak with some of the developers. Visually, it's face melting and if you are glow stick junky, you're going to feel right at home tracing crazy shapes all over the place like I did. We can't forget the sound... the ambience makes the visuals pop, part carcadian rhythm, part cuckoo juice that turns any sane human into a crazed monkey addicted to drinking battery acid. In other words, it's best described as if the Secret Life of Walter Mitty fell in love with Adventures of Baron Munchausen. I even think that every stage performer/artist could only dream of giving an experience like this to their audience. Kiss those dreams goodbye because, well, it's real now but in a virtual reality kind of way. 

I could go on about the visuals and how it's psychedelic, magical, Alice in Wonderland-ish but what really stuck out was the social aspect of the experience. Sharing a "trip" had just about everybody going, "whoa, this is cool" especially when you had that one thing we bought in the game that just made you feel like you just melted, man, just melted. For someone my age, now 35, I'm transported back to "high" school and college during the good ol' transformative years of experimentation and connecting at different wave lengths with people. The presentation and environment is every bit tie dye and whimsey with hearts floating all around you when you make friends with people... Oddly satisfying and sort of erotic, in a cartoony way. In one instance, I got lost in the overworld with someone and we traveled together and met back with the group. It's tough not to get giddy. 

As far as immersion goes, TheWaveVR, just effin' nails it. Think about the Nintendo days when games slowed down and that actually helped you beat a game or when you have to wait in line at a busy club and they let all the girls in but kept all the guys outside because the door guy was being a bucket of cement... It was exactly like that. Everyone was so anxious to get in and spend all their hard earned trippy pills, the only way to protest was to start putting on a lightshow at the door. Even though several of us were a few trippy pills short, there was enough bromance to go around. And then I got in... I started to feel sorry for the bros waiting outside in the cold. I know they would have felt the same for me (I think lol) but I knew they were there for the same reason. Our destinies lied where the DJ booth was shreading the tables so they would understand it wasn't my fault that the computer chose me instead of them. 

Despite some of the glitches, I came out utterly surprised about what I really liked about TheWaveVR. You could take a single player game and if it crashes, steam is going to be pouring out of your ears. If you are playing a multiplayer game where it's player(s) vs player(s), you are going to get pissed off that you can't put digital bullets inside somebodies pixel skull or when the loading screen just goes on and on. I know we've all been through these types of scenarios and many times just makes the blood curl. Where TheWaveVR succeeds is how it draws connections between people that are in it and with the dj. So what if you've lost a few brain cells bugging out with some random person you met. Are you honestly going to tell me that the last Wolverine movie you saw was so intellectually stimulating? Probably not. I'll tell you this though, there is social intelligence baked into the concept of this app. From the connecting umbilical chord when people are all drawing, shared tripping experiences, to the dj tonguing our ears with the beats and painting our eyes to the rhythm. I still can't get over not being able to get "into the club" (some waited 45 minutes)... and even if someone was anxious, well, we all shared that anxiety... Here man, I got something that might take some of the edge off. 

THINGS I LIKE: 
+ Fast teleport
+ Trippy visuals
+ Engaging with people
+ Glitches and waiting to get into the club

WISHLIST:
- Having a map, nsew
- A board with all the performers and when they are scheduled to perform
- A board with most popular performers
- make a cocktail out of the trippy pills
- purchase/free albums for attending event
- open mic nights. 
- be able to toggle between music and people talking
- live broadcast for those goobers who don't have vr  (kidding, I still love you even if you are one "d" short of 3d)

8 Graphics: plain background, awesome special effects. 
8 Control: teleport, 8, superfast and I yet have to race someone from end to the other, needs hot keys
9 Comfort: w/ teleport you don't get sick
10 Sound & Music: drop the base!


I love this one. I still can't get over having to wait outside to get into the club. There needs to be VIP service!

31129717.review:
Happened to show up during a .... show? A guy was djing, the beat was infections, the visuals were blowing my mind and I was slapping hearts all over the people around me. I honestly didn't want the jam to end, but it seemed I caught the tail end of the show. Exploring the MMO musical wastelands and visiting other peoples caves is a fun twist. Lots of musical experiments to play with. My controller wouldn't stop vibrating in one persons cave, so I left even though I was jamming. Lots of fun, I will be looking forward to the next show. It was quite polished and there are a lot of small details to keep it all interesting, like entering into a two player shooting gallery right in the middle of the dance. 

10/10 I would dance in my basement and hope nobody came downstairs next week.

31128511.review: It's a pretty incredible experience already. This is one of the most exciting things I've seen in VR. I don't know if it's a limitation of the game or a glitch but I couldn't see that many people at a time including a friend I was trying to meet up with. It'd be amazing if I could join friends from my steam list at some point.

31128381.review: While there are definitely still issues, this is the scoial experience in VR.  Absouletely kills the social interactions and the live acts are great for bringing strangers together.

31128258.review: As a music lover and festival goer that was one of the coolest things I've done. Since it's free everyone should download this!

31128045.review: Wow truly awesome . Groundbreaking experience !! Great job cant wait to see where this goes. amazing !!

31126847.review:
This is such an incredible VR experience, I am speechless.

People are discussing what VR applications must look like.
So we can see lots of, you know, ported horror games, ported FPS etc etc.
But this is proper VR EXPERIENCE. Like "NEW MEDIA" VR Experience. It exists on VR and for this kind of immersion it could only exist on VR, not on computer screen.

Future for VR is here, right now.
And I hope in the future this community (can't use word 'multiplayer' here because this is not a game and there is no players) VR experience will do great. Because exactly this kind of applications with this quality should promote VR into masses.

Also it is free so why dont you try it? :)

31126259.review: This is a really cool idea...can't wait to see where this goes....love the DJ booth..

31126071.review: I know reviewing this game is a bit early, but I truly believe this game has potential to become a VR experience unlike anything else. I really appreciate the developers behind this, and I'm so thankful to play this game. I'm looking forward to see what the developers have in store for this game in the future. As someone who is quite fond of the EDM community, I think I've found my VR home. <3

31125322.review: As a musician and a DJ experiencing the first 15 mins of this just blew me away... and that's before I've even seen a show or tried the DJ decks!

31124820.review: If you are the one that goes to nightclubs and love it!? There is no doubt this one will beat that feeling! VR when it at it´s best!

31124591.review:
I have been mixing for about 19 years now and since the day I got my Vive I have been waiting for something like this to come out. The mixing features are a bit limited and you can only mix with the tracks provided. But if the devs add the ability to add your own music and the tools to be able to properly beat match, this software is going to be amazing.

Despite the above shortcomings this experience is well worth trying. A wonderful way to interact with music and other people, without leaving the comfort of your own home.

31122937.review: Really cool experience, would suggest it to anyone that likes EDM. The DJ system is really fun - I wish there was a way to load my own tracks.

31121456.review: Even though this is Free....  I feel like I should be compensated for the 8 minutes of my life that I wasted

31118051.review:
It was not sweaty and cramped inside a warehouse with people who actually seemed to enjoy themselves.

THE FUTURE OF EDM

31115565.review:
I believe this is very likely going to be a huge application in the VR world. While it does aim at the party goer in so many ways, it also has the best social interaction and audio system I have encountered in VR (and I have been looking).

The spatial awareness is the best in VR right now, I believe, and it could lead to great things for this app. I have already booked a meeting session with family members who own VR.

It's real purpose is to have a great time in a party atmosphere, a party in VR, and it really delivers. You really feel like you are in a place with many people, experiencing the same thing.

Its free, and the developer I spoke with last night suggested it was going to remain free. They expect to make revenue from the sale of in app items which should work out well for them, as tthere are many opportunities from live gig tickets to virtual clothing, music tracks etc.

This has been hovering around on Steam for ages (like Budget Cuts) and has finally been released and was worth the wait. I hope and believe the same will be true of Budget Cuts.

31115276.review: I don't normally write reviews but this was the best vr experience I've had in a while. It's an amazing concept and from what I've played of the alpha, it's executed really smoothly. Musically, artistically and as a social platform there's huge potential here and it's definitely a place I would regularly go to be a part of live music.

31112427.review:
这应用不得了！不敢想象，以后这个VR世界会被大家创造成怎么样，太迷幻了！从音乐入手搞VR社交，真是选对路了！

搞音乐的不玩这个怎行？！为了这个都应该必入VIVE！不然就要落后时代啦，未来（其实已经是现在时了）的音乐演出形式已经到来，这是一个新的音乐艺术形式，以后大家都到这表演和看演出了，在各种音乐派对上狂欢！

31111704.review: The early access was absolutely amazing. There are a few glitches to be fixed, but the concept in general is crazy. If you're a festival goer, you love raves and edm, this is for you. The visuals in this is absolutely wild. And the social interactions are just as crazy. Sharing trips, live djing. It's amazing.

31110213.review: This was alot of fun.  I had a great session and enjoyed the mechanics of the equipment.  I am excited for what comes next as this is a very polished experience overall.  This can be something amazing depending on how deep the Devs go on this.  I mean it could be a performance platform for actual in person experiences.  My brain is spinning with what this could become.  Good job devs!

31109752.review: Best vr experience i've had so far.

31109641.review: Wow! This is going to change how we view live music. Can't wait to see where this goes.

31109628.review: You can be a pill pusher in VR,  you can share your trips with another person lol

31109257.review: To the developer--- Are you expanding it to Rift also anytime soon?

31108997.review: Wow! This game is quite the trip. If you like colorful trippy games, I'd highly recommend this. It merges the fun interactive side of rec room with the creative musical side of soundstage. Definitely worth checking out.

31108907.review:
This is genuinely the future of social interaction in VR.

If going to a VR nightclub sounds like your kind of thing, just download it and go to the next scheduled show. Once you're in the Social Lobby, there's a big tall billboard with the details and a countdown, and you can check for announcements on their Twitter.

Beyond anything, the sense of presence in this world is astounding. Immersion on this level is mind blowing, where no other game or app in VR so far has had me take off my headset and go 'Oh yeah, this is what the real world is.' Genuinely you are in another world, interacting with people, making new friends, dancing together with futuristic space glowsticks and poi spinners, and sharing psychadelic experiences in the form of Trip Potions.

And that's before you get into the nightclub itself.

Right now, you can't host your own show in the main stage, but you can go into the social area and make some friends then host a house party, DJ for them and play around with the insane visuals. This is all in the very early stages, but with a friend system, clear voice communication, customizable avatars, and a world to explore beyond the stage this is genuinely something to try.

31108617.review: now that right there was a life changing experience. WOW. The Home DJ room where you can party with your friends and the main DJ stage on the scheduled events with everyone else. Oh man simply Incredible.

39394743.review:
TheWaveVR Beta is a Free social VR music program.  It worked on my system, looked ok, played ok, sounded good.   You can host your own DJ show at your own place, with light show included.  Has a selection of music included in the game.

Try it if you like being a DJ or going to raves.

I am sure these types of things will come but I will definetly be buying this once it comes out.

39241072.review: This Vr experience has great potential. I thoroughly enjoyed the time I have spent roaming around the world. The ability to intuitively step in and Dj is great. There are many features that I would love to see integrated. But for the moment I feel this is a great proof of concept for what this application could be. Hope to see consistent development on this, excited to see where the devs take it.

39137279.review: This game is super fun. I'd recommend it because it's completely free. There are some things that could be improved, but the concept is executed well and the live concerts are pretty dang cool.

38967084.review:
I...don't get it. The complete lack of instructions left me confused the entire time. I eventually joined a room that was featured in the public hub and it ended up being a large room with sparkles everywhere that lasted for a few seconds before it kicked me back to the hub. What in the world is the point of this game?

On top of that, this is the ONLY game in my library that got my hands mixed up, thinking my left hand was my right and vice versa. This was even after coming straight from playing 3 other games so there was no possibility of me switching hands before booting the title. I don't get the positive reviews. Save your time, even if the game is free.

40932847.review: I've got to say I've had some of the coolest VR experiences in TheWave.  It is best when there is a scheduled DJ coming in.  You get a group just dancing, listening and taking this experience you can only get in VR.  You just can't help but join in.  Do make sure to go around and collect some coins so that you can get some of the cool add ons.  It all just adds to the experience.  An experience is exactly what this is.

40202339.review: Straight up doesn't work.  Bad frame rate and unresponsive touch controls, plus constant connection errors.

39619048.review:
This game makes EDC look like childs play.

I've been a huge EDM fan for the past several years. I just went to my first Vegas Electric Daisy Carnival in 2017. I didn't expect anything to ever be able to top that experience...until I tried this.

You know all the crazy visuals on screen for EDM concerts? Imagine being IN one of them.

The visuals combined with the music are beyond astounding. The trips legitimately made me feel like I'm tripping.

You get small achievements for exploring and being social.  This game was designed to be social and it's best experienced like that. 

You can get currency to spend on trips, which range from psychedelic visuals to fun little mini games. You can also buy streamers and fire nunchucks and hottubs.

The population is low. I only found 4 people online when I was on at most,  but everyone is always friendly.  Dancing and tripping with randoms is a lot of fun.

You have your own cave in which you can create your own music and image.  I've tinkered a bit and it seems like you can really create your own unique aesthetic. 

You can mix and fade and distort the music in different ways and host parties at these locations as well.

I haven't done a live music show but I'm extremely excited.  I want more people to play this.

If you like electronic music and amazing mind warping visuals, you're at home.
